required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Massage Therapy on Hamstrings in Patients With Nonspecific Low Back Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Massage Therapy on Hamstrings in Patients With Nonspecific Low Back Pain

brief_summary.textblock: Effectiveness of a technique of dynamic massage therapy in the hamstrings in patients with nonspecific low back pain.

detailed_description.textblock: The main objective of this study is to test the effectiveness of a technique of dynamic massage therapy in the hamstrings in patients with nonspecific low back pain. Secondary objectives are assess whether the technique of dynamic massage therapy increases the extensibility of the hamstrings, assess whether the treatment of hamstrings decreases low back pain and determine whether the application of this technique decreases the disability associated with nonspecific low back pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Hamstrings extensibility measured with sit-and-reach test
primary_outcome.description: Fixing a meter stick on top of a solid box so that 26 cm of the ruler extend over the front edge of the box toward the test subject. Used to check the increase in hip flexion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Low back pain measured with visual analog scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two weeks. Participants will be followed for four weeks after completion of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The subject indicates the intensity of pain by marking a 100-mm horizontal line with two extremes: no pain and worst imaginable pain. Used to check the decrease low back pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Low back disability measured with the Oswestry Disability Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two weeks. Participants will be followed for four weeks after completion of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Oswestry Disability Questionnaire is an important tool to measure functional low back disability. For each section the total possible score is 5: if the first statement is marked the section score = 0; if the last statement is marked, it = 5. If all 10 sections are completed the score is calculated as follows: Example: 16 (total scored) 50 (total possible score) x 100 = 32%

arm_group.description: Rubbing on hamstrings combined with articular movement

intervention.description: Dynamic massage therapy on hamstring combined with knee extension

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-65 years old.
- Low back pain with over three months of evolution.
- Practice sports regularly (at least three times a week).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Fractures, Tumors, congenital anomalies, rheumatic diseases, infectious or inflammatory processes.
- Pathology Nerve root
- Presence of neurological deficit or neuromuscular diseases.
- Surgery
- Physiotherapy treatment for low back pain in the last 30 days.
- Drugs in previous 24h
